metadata.Title: CVE-2014-8112 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description: 389 Directory Server 1.3.1.x, 1.3.2.x before 1.3.2.27, and 1.3.3.x before 1.3.3.9 stores "unhashed" passwords even when the nsslapd-unhashed-pw-switch option is set to off, which allows remote authenticated users to obtain sensitive information by reading the Changelog.

criterions.comment: 389-ds-base: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
